forager

Class PhasedForager

  • java.lang.Object
    • forager.PhasedForager

  • public class PhasedForager
extends java.lang.Object
    A*-based search algorithm that operates in two phases.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PhasedForager(Dungeon dungeon)
      Initialises the forager for a particular dungeon.

      Initialises the forager for a particular dungeon.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhasedForager

        public PhasedForager(Dungeon dungeon)
        Initialises the forager for a particular dungeon.
        Parameters:
        dungeon - Dungeon the forager is being used for.

      • PhasedForager

        public PhasedForager(Dungeon dungeon,
                     boolean reusing)
        Initialises the forager for a particular dungeon.
        Parameters:
        dungeon - Dungeon the forager is being used for.
        reusing - true to reuse VisitMaps, false to not do so.

    • Method Detail

      • searchPath

        public Step searchPath(Tile startTile,
                       Tile goalTile,
                       int energy,
                       Heuristic heuristic)
        Two-phased search algorithm that simplifies the search by first calculating by first calculating routes between all special tiles.
        Parameters:
        startTile - the starting tile of the search.
        goalTile - the goal tile for the search.
        energy - amount of energy at the beginning of the search.
        heuristic - heuristic to be used by the heap.
        Returns:
        the step that first reached the goal tile if successful, null if not.

      • handleNewStep

        public Step handleNewStep(Line line,
                          Step currentStep)
        Creates a new step if the check is possible with the energy available and checks if a new cycle is needed for the new step.
        Parameters:
        line - Line from the current step currently under consideration to a new tile.
        currentStep - The step from which the line originates.
        Returns:
        new Step if the step is possible, null if not.

      • createNewCycle

        public Cycle createNewCycle(Step currentStep,
                            Tile tile)
        Creates a new cycle with either the old visit map or the new one. A new visit map based on the previous one and the newly reached tile is created, and then used to check if an earlier one with the same explored special tiles exists. If so, the earlier visit map is used.
        Parameters:
        currentStep - The step from which the line originates
        tile - The tile that was just reached.
        Returns:
        new cycle, null if the tile was already explored in the pre-existing visit map.

      • createNeigborLists

        public void createNeigborLists(int maxEnergy,
                               Tile startTile,
                               Tile goalTile)
        Handles creation of neighbor lists for all special tiles.
        Parameters:
        maxEnergy - Maximum amount of energy considered for each step.
        startTile - the start tile for the entire search
        goalTile - the goal tile for the search

      • findAccessibleSpecialTiles

        public MyArrayList<Line> findAccessibleSpecialTiles(Tile startTile,
                                                    int maxEnergy)
        Calculates the best route from one special tile to every other special tile at range using Dijkstra with a fixed range limit.
        Parameters:
        startTile - Tile
        maxEnergy - Maximum distance in energy for the search.
        Returns:
        MyArrayList object containing all possible routes from startTiles.

      • getVisitTree

        public VisitTree getVisitTree()
        Returns the root of the visit tree used by PhasedForager. Only needed in tests.
        Returns:
        Root of the visit tree

      • getReuses

        public int getReuses()
        Returns the amount of reuses of VisitMaps during a run. Used for diagnostics and tests.
        Returns:
        number of reuses

      • getCycles

        public int getCycles()
        Returns the amount of new cycles with a new VisitMap during a run. Used for diagnostics and tests.
        Returns:
        number of cycles
